oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 131-133 Second Avenue North architectural survey, circa 1980, 1994
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Architecture; Buildings; Business; Capitol City; Downtown Nashville; Architectural surveys--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture--Details; Architecture--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture, Victorian--Tennessee--Nashville; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Central business districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Commercial buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic preservation--Tennessee--Nashville; History--Societies, etc.--Tennessee--Nashville
Nashville (Tenn.)--Buildings, structures, etc.; Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Second Avenue (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed architectural and historical survey of the building spanning the addresses of 131 Second Avenue North and 133 Second Avenue North, consisting of photographs and documents created in 1980 and 1994. Black and white photographs are of the exterior front or street view of the building, with some views from an angle to the side, sometimes showing adjacent buildings. Some photographs show upper portions of the building or architectural details. Some photographs may also show storefronts, signs, pedestrians, vehicles, and street scenes. Documents contain architectural descriptions. This building was built around 1900. It is made of brick and is five stories tall. Forms part of Historic Nashville Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Historic Nashville, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church St., Nashville, Tennessee 37219
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Historic Nashville, Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey
